alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 8:46PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Boise and south central Valley Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 845 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clear Creek Summit, or 9 miles north of Lowman, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clear Creek Summit and Deadwood Reservoir around 850 PM MDT. Deer Creek Pass around 910 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southwestern Idaho.
